title: What is a master hearing in immigration court?
question: my husband has an attorney representing him for a master hearing in immigration court... what is a master hearing.
question_tags: Immigration,Deportation,Immigration detention,Immigration court,Bankruptcy,Debt,Debt relief,Bankruptcy and debt,Master calendar hearing and immigration court,Deportation defense
answers:
A person who must go see the Immigration Judge for removal [deportation] proceedings, if they are not in ICE detention will go, first, to a Master Calendar hearing. Very often the first Master Calendar hearing results only in a continuance to another date either because the person does not have an attorney and needs more time to find one; or, if they have an attorney, because the attorney needs more time to prepare [by getting a copy of the person's USCIS/USICE file, etc.], and determine how to answer the charges on the Notice to Appear [NTA] which the government has filed.

If more time is being requested, the person does not plead to [answer] the charges in the NTA., nor state what "relief" they will be requesting. There are many ways to answer the charges, and many possible types of relief available. Only a competent immigration lawyer can decide those things.

The hearing when the Judge hears all the witnesses, and takes all the evidence in order to decide the case, is called the Regular or Individual Hearing. Sometimes, if there are a lot of witnesses and a lot of evidence, the Individual Hearing will have to be put over to another date.

However, everyone does not get an Individual Hearing. It depends upon whether you have any relief available to you. Again, only a competent immigration lawyer, who specializes in deportation defense can decide those things.

There are basically two different kinds of hearings in Immigration Court. An 'Individual' hearing is where the actual trial takes place and where the Immigration Judge will actually make a decision on the case. Everything else would fall under the ambit of a ''Master" hearing. All hearings are very important will affect the next one. Please see below.

Regards,

Brian D. Lerner
Attorney at Law

The master hearing is usually the first hearing where the judge usually:

1. Calendar the individual hearing (hearing of the merits of the case);
2. Where you plead including the relief(s), you are going to ask

However, a master calendar can serve many more purposes and can happen several times. Talk to your immigration lawyer for more details

Good Luck
